pullRequest.title: Checkstyle version increment and checks update
pullRequest.bodyText:
Update checkstyle version to 8.37 and plugin to 3.1.1.
Removes checkstyle suppressions that are no longer relevant to the project.
Removes naming restrictions for service client methods. [ServiceClientCheck]
Removes the requirement for complaining about the Static ClientLogger instance [GoodLoggingCheck]
Add ReturnType.Poller for LRO checkstyle formatting.

nodes.bodyText: In the future, for all of these types we check that aren't final, we'll want to use a more comprehensive validation to support sub-types (this is the current pain point with PagedFlux where sub-types get used in multiple locations)
Do we want to suppress Checkstyles for modules that use the client (Track 2) parent? The current POM configurations only apply Checkstyles to Track 2 libraries
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -11,17 +11,15 @@
   <suppress checks="RedundantModifier"
             files="keyvault[/\\]microsoft-azure-.*[/\\].*[/\\](IKey|ISignatureTransform|KeyVaultClientBase|KeyVaultClientCustom)\.java"/>
 
-  <!-- AutoRest generates with unused imports. Remove this suppression when:
-  https://github.com/Azure/autorest.java/issues/330 is fixed. -->
-  <suppress checks="UnusedImports" files="batch[/\\]microsoft-azure-batch[/\\].*[/\\]batch[/\\]protocol[/\\].*\.java"/>
-
   <!-- Add Javadoc suppression for any test files (ie. ones that live under src/test/java). -->
   <suppress checks="Javadoc" files="src[/\\]test[/\\]java[/\\].*.java"/>
-
   <suppress checks="Javadoc" files=".*CoverageReporter\.java"/>
   <suppress checks="Javadoc" files=".*[/\\]implementation[/\\].*\.java"/>
-  <suppress checks="Javadoc" files=".*[/\\]com[/\\]microsoft[/\\].*"/>
   <suppress checks="Header" files=".*package-info.java"/>
+  <!-- Suppress LineLength for Track 1/management libraries. -->
+  <suppress checks="[a-zA-Z0-9]*" files=".*[/\\]com[/\\]microsoft[/\\].*"/>

nodes.bodyText: Could we modify the above to cover this?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -11,17 +11,15 @@
   <suppress checks="RedundantModifier"
             files="keyvault[/\\]microsoft-azure-.*[/\\].*[/\\](IKey|ISignatureTransform|KeyVaultClientBase|KeyVaultClientCustom)\.java"/>
 
-  <!-- AutoRest generates with unused imports. Remove this suppression when:
-  https://github.com/Azure/autorest.java/issues/330 is fixed. -->
-  <suppress checks="UnusedImports" files="batch[/\\]microsoft-azure-batch[/\\].*[/\\]batch[/\\]protocol[/\\].*\.java"/>
-
   <!-- Add Javadoc suppression for any test files (ie. ones that live under src/test/java). -->
   <suppress checks="Javadoc" files="src[/\\]test[/\\]java[/\\].*.java"/>
-
   <suppress checks="Javadoc" files=".*CoverageReporter\.java"/>
   <suppress checks="Javadoc" files=".*[/\\]implementation[/\\].*\.java"/>
-  <suppress checks="Javadoc" files=".*[/\\]com[/\\]microsoft[/\\].*"/>
   <suppress checks="Header" files=".*package-info.java"/>
+  <!-- Suppress LineLength for Track 1/management libraries. -->
+  <suppress checks="[a-zA-Z0-9]*" files=".*[/\\]com[/\\]microsoft[/\\].*"/>
+  <!-- Custom checkstyle rules only check track 2 libraries -->
+  <suppress checks="com\.azure\.tools\.checkstyle\.checks\..+" files=".*[/\\]com[/\\]microsoft[/\\].*"/>

nodes.bodyText: Is this diff created by mistake?
I wonder if this would be better named 'LONG_RUNNING_OPERATION'?
This change is to allow static logger instances named LOGGER
I think this check should still be there but modified to allow static loggers only if the logger is used within static methods. Instance methods should not use static loggers.
!returnType.contains(PAGED_FLUX)  is sufficient as it covers both conditions.
Should this also have contains check instead?
Has the checkstyle issue flagging these vocabulary violations been fixed?
